channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Doctor Launches Vision Quest To Help Astronauts' Eyeballs
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/04/518214299/doctor-launches-vision-quest-to-help-astronauts-eyeballs

item.title: A Dip In Global Prices Creates Cocoa Crisis For Ivory Coast's Farmers
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Ivory coast is the world's largest cocoa producer. But a bumper crop combined with a fall in the global demand for chocolate and a dip in cocoa prices are hurting the country's cocoa farmers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Ivory coast is the world's largest cocoa producer. But a bumper crop combined with a fall in the global demand for chocolate and a dip in cocoa prices are hurting the country's cocoa farmers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/518328252/a-dip-in-global-prices-creates-cocoa-crisis-for-ivory-coasts-farmers

item.title: Rick Perry Looks To Bring Texas Approach To Energy Department
item.description: March 3, 2017 - On Thursday, former Texas Gov. Rick Perry was sworn in as the energy secretary for the Trump administration. NPR looks ahead to a series of upcoming pieces examining Perry's role in expanding wind energy production in Texas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - On Thursday, former Texas Gov. Rick Perry was sworn in as the energy secretary for the Trump administration. NPR looks ahead to a series of upcoming pieces examining Perry's role in expanding wind energy production in Texas. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/03/518391625/rick-perry-looks-to-bring-texas-approach-to-energy-department

item.title: The Culprit In Rising Western U.S. Smog Levels: Asia
item.description: March 3, 2017 - U.S. emissions of smog-forming pollutants have dropped, but smog levels in the western U.S. have increased each year. Now, researchers say, they've found out why — it's wafting from across the Pacific Ocean.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - U.S. emissions of smog-forming pollutants have dropped, but smog levels in the western U.S. have increased each year. Now, researchers say, they've found out why — it's wafting from across the Pacific Ocean. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/03/518391618/the-culprit-in-rising-western-u-s-smog-levels-asia

item.title: Do Showers Make Oranges Taste Better? NPR Investigates
item.description: March 3, 2017 - The Internet is full of things, including a Reddit subgroup devoted to the act of eating an orange in the shower. We gave it a shot ourselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - The Internet is full of things, including a Reddit subgroup devoted to the act of eating an orange in the shower. We gave it a shot ourselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/518323093/do-showers-make-oranges-taste-better-npr-investigates

item.title: Patients Demand The 'Right To Try' Experimental Drugs, But Costs Can Be Steep
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Terminally ill patients want easier access to candidate medicines still in the earliest stages of testing. While 33 states have passed laws to enable that, ethicists also warn of big risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Terminally ill patients want easier access to candidate medicines still in the earliest stages of testing. While 33 states have passed laws to enable that, ethicists also warn of big risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/03/517796956/patients-demand-the-right-to-try-experimental-drugs-but-costs-can-be-steep

item.title: Smog In Western U.S. Starts Out As Pollution In Asia, Researchers Say
item.description: March 3, 2017 - By tripling their emission of pollutants, Asian countries have contributed as much as 65 percent of a rise in ozone levels in the western U.S., scientists say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - By tripling their emission of pollutants, Asian countries have contributed as much as 65 percent of a rise in ozone levels in the western U.S., scientists say. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/03/518323094/rise-in-smog-in-western-u-s-is-blamed-on-asias-air-pollution

item.title: Rise Of The Robot Bees: Tiny Drones Turned Into Artificial Pollinators
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Honeybees are a critical part of agriculture, pollinating many of our favorite crops. But bee deaths are on the rise. In Japan, scientists are testing whether insect-sized drones can help do the job.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Honeybees are a critical part of agriculture, pollinating many of our favorite crops. But bee deaths are on the rise. In Japan, scientists are testing whether insect-sized drones can help do the job. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/517785082/rise-of-the-robot-bees-tiny-drones-turned-into-artificial-pollinators

item.title: First Clouded Leopard Cub Born Using Cryopreserved Semen
item.description: March 2, 2017 - A statement from the Smithsonian National Zoo and the Nashville Zoo said Thursday that the accomplishment is "a giant step for global conservation efforts."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - A statement from the Smithsonian National Zoo and the Nashville Zoo said Thursday that the accomplishment is "a giant step for global conservation efforts." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/02/518230414/first-clouded-leopard-cub-born-using-cryopreserved-semen

item.title: Rick Perry Sworn In As Energy Secretary
item.description: March 2, 2017 - The former Texas governor was confirmed Thursday by a 62-37 vote in the Senate. While running for president in 2011, Perry pledged to eliminate the department, but he says he's changed his mind.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - The former Texas governor was confirmed Thursday by a 62-37 vote in the Senate. While running for president in 2011, Perry pledged to eliminate the department, but he says he's changed his mind. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/02/518235070/rick-perry-sworn-in-as-energy-secretary

item.title: Embryo Experiments On Human Development Raise Ethical Concerns
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Embryo-like entities are being created in a New York lab using human embryonic stem cells. Scientists hope to learn more about the earliest stages of human development without using actual embryos.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Embryo-like entities are being created in a New York lab using human embryonic stem cells. Scientists hope to learn more about the earliest stages of human development without using actual embryos. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518197104/embryo-experiments-on-human-development-raise-ethical-concerns

item.title: Old Penicillin Mold Auctioned For More Than $14,000
item.description:
March 2, 2017 - An auction house in London has sold a dish containing a sample of the original mold that made Penicillin for over $14,000.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518197111/old-penicillin-mold-auctioned-for-more-than-14-000
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: New Research Looks At Ways To Help Stop Airbnb Racial Discrimination
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Airbnb has come under fire in the last year following reports that hosts are less likely to rent to African-Americans compared to whites. New research looked at ways to address the discrimination.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Airbnb has come under fire in the last year following reports that hosts are less likely to rent to African-Americans compared to whites. New research looked at ways to address the discrimination. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518087610/new-research-looks-at-ways-to-help-stop-airbnb-racial-discrimination

item.title: Embryo Experiments Reveal Earliest Human Development, But Stir Ethical Debate
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/02/516280895/embryo-experiments-reveal-earliest-human-development-but-stir-ethical-debate

item.title: Sierra Snowpack Smacks California's Drought
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Despite one of the wettest winters on record, California Gov. Jerry Brown hasn't declared the five-year drought over yet. But the water shortages may to be over.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Despite one of the wettest winters on record, California Gov. Jerry Brown hasn't declared the five-year drought over yet. But the water shortages may to be over. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/01/518042343/sierra-snowpack-smacks-california-s-drought
